---
title: "Hello, Quarto"
format: html
editor: visual
---





## Figure Questions

**Q1** ![Adelie penguins](adelie.jpg){#fig-adelie fig-alt="Two cute Adelie penguins walking" fig-align="center" width="80%"}

**Q2** Adelie penguins have the shortest average Bill length. Check out @fig-adelie to see if this is true!

## Tables

**Q1&Q2**

| Species   | Count |
|-----------|------:|
| Adelie    |   152 |
| Chinstrap |    68 |
| Gentoo    |   124 |

: Penguin Species Count

**Q3**



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
penguins %>% 
  count(species) %>%
    knitr::kable(caption = "Penguin Species Count",
                 col.names = c("Species", "Count"))
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Penguin Species Count

|Species   | Count|
|:---------|-----:|
|Adelie    |   152|
|Chinstrap |    68|
|Gentoo    |   124|


:::
:::



## Two-column Layout

::: {layout-ncol="2"}
![](gentoo.jpg)

| Species   | Count |
|-----------|------:|
| Adelie    |   152 |
| Chinstrap |    68 |
| Gentoo    |   124 |
:::

## Backup Codes



::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
head(penguins) # a preview of the first few rows of the penguins dataset
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 6 × 8
  species island    bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g
  <fct>   <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <int>       <int>
1 Adelie  Torgersen           39.1          18.7               181        3750
2 Adelie  Torgersen           39.5          17.4               186        3800
3 Adelie  Torgersen           40.3          18                 195        3250
4 Adelie  Torgersen           NA            NA                  NA          NA
5 Adelie  Torgersen           36.7          19.3               193        3450
6 Adelie  Torgersen           39.3          20.6               190        3650
# ℹ 2 more variables: sex <fct>, year <int>
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
penguins %>% 
  count(species) # count the number of penguins by species
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 3 × 2
  species       n
  <fct>     <int>
1 Adelie      152
2 Chinstrap    68
3 Gentoo      124
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
penguins %>% 
  group_by(species) %>% # group the analysis by species
  summarize(across(where(is.numeric), mean, na.rm = TRUE)) 
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stderr}

```
Warning: There was 1 warning in `summarize()`.
ℹ In argument: `across(where(is.numeric), mean, na.rm = TRUE)`.
ℹ In group 1: `species = Adelie`.
Caused by warning:
! The `...` argument of `across()` is deprecated as of dplyr 1.1.0.
Supply arguments directly to `.fns` through an anonymous function instead.

  # Previously
  across(a:b, mean, na.rm = TRUE)

  # Now
  across(a:b, \(x) mean(x, na.rm = TRUE))
```


:::

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}

```
# A tibble: 3 × 6
  species   bill_length_mm bill_depth_mm flipper_length_mm body_mass_g  year
  <fct>              <dbl>         <dbl>             <dbl>       <dbl> <dbl>
1 Adelie              38.8          18.3              190.       3701. 2008.
2 Chinstrap           48.8          18.4              196.       3733. 2008.
3 Gentoo              47.5          15.0              217.       5076. 2008.
```


:::

```{.r .cell-code}
  #for each numeric column, calculate the mean excluding na values
```
:::

::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
penguins %>% 
  group_by(species) %>% 
  summarize(across(where(is.numeric), mean, na.rm = TRUE)) %>%
    knitr::kable(caption = "Analysis by Penguin Species")
```

::: {.cell-output-display}


Table: Analysis by Penguin Species

|species   | bill_length_mm| bill_depth_mm| flipper_length_mm| body_mass_g|     year|
|:---------|--------------:|-------------:|-----------------:|-----------:|--------:|
|Adelie    |       38.79139|      18.34636|          189.9536|    3700.662| 2008.013|
|Chinstrap |       48.83382|      18.42059|          195.8235|    3733.088| 2007.971|
|Gentoo    |       47.50488|      14.98211|          217.1870|    5076.016| 2008.081|


:::
:::
